subject: p17340686
Findings: A large caliber left approach central venous catheter terminates in the right atrium, unchanged from prior. There is new opacification of the retrocardiac space which could reflect pneumonia or aspiration in the appropriate clinical circumstance. Atelectasis is also within the differential. Mild diffuse interstitial abnormality is unchanged compared to multiple prior radiographs. There is no large pleural effusion. No pneumothorax is evident. There is evidence of stable pulmonary hypertension and vascular engorgement, unchanged from prior. Moderate cardiomegaly is unchanged. Deformity of proximal right humerus appears chronic.
Impression: New retrocardiac opacity which could reflect aspiration, infection or atelectasis. Unchanged background interstitial abnormality and central vascular enlargement.
